properties.name: 1st Shared Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl This was the first apartment I lived in with my girlfriend. It was awesome for a first time, we had a yard, garage, trampoline, and nice big windows in the living room. The landlord was crazy but it was a good deal. We eventually got evicted because her son and daughter-in-law moved in below us and decided they didn\'t like us anymore so they told mommy and she booted us. Now that we\'re a little more legal minded, we understand that what they did was illegal and could\'ve pressed charges. Oh well. We moved out at midnight in a mad dash, creating so much noise the tenants below us had to sleep elsewhere for the night (oh damn).

properties.name: Base Housing at Davis Monthan
properties.description: Posted by JerrylTucson, AZThis is the first house my mom and I lived in after my parents divorced. It was a duplex and being that is was on base there were plenty of kids around. I had a great time living there. I walked down the street to school everyday and hung out with my friends around the neighborhood. Didn\'t have to worry about anything being as it was on base. They used to have an ice cream truck come around a couple times a week. Apparently they\'ve demolished the exact house I was living in.

properties.name: Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by JerrylGuamThis is where I was born. My parents were in the Air Force so this is where I came into the world. I remember nothing about this place as I was 6 months old when I left.

properties.name: Brooklyn's
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 5445 Olde Wadsworth Blvd, Arvada, CO 80002Nice pool hall. Lots of tournaments. Bar boxes, 9ft, lots of tables.

properties.name: Butterfly Pavilion
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl6252 W 104th, Westminster, COThis is where I proposed to my first wife. Among the beautiful butterflies. We had an older couple take our photo after they recognized what I was doing.

properties.name: Elementary/Junior High Schools
properties.description: Posted by JerrylFrankFurt, GermanyThis is where I attended some elementary and junior high while living in Germany. My mother was stationed at Rhein-Main AFB which shared the airport with Germany. This base no longer exists and all has been turned back over to the Germans.

properties.name: First Apartment
properties.description: Posted by JerrylCheyenne, WYThis was the location of my first apartment. I had decided to move out and was making enough money to afford a decent apartment. I was on the second floor and could finally do whatever I wanted! When I left I accidentally clogged the sewage system with paper towels while cleaning. Oops. Didn\'t get my deposit back either. I lived here for about 6 months before moving over to Laramie (1st Shared Apartment)

properties.name: First Denver Apartment
properties.description: Posted by JerrylMy first place in Denver. I had to move down into this apartment alone while my fiance finished up school in Laramie, WY. It was a lonely time, but I had my cat, Maggie, to help. I lived on the third floor of the building I was in and that was a pain in the ass to move into. It was a great, bright apartment though. I would\'ve opted for a more expensive place, but paying two rents wouldn\'t allow me at the time. I spent 5 months in this place before moving into my first house, although I signed a 7 month lease.

properties.name: First Home
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 9304 Weeping WIllow Pl, Highlands Ranch, CO 80130This is my first house that I purchased with my first wife at the age of 23. I lived in it for approximately two years before moving out after a seperation and divorce with my wife. It\'s all good though, it just wasn\'t our time. The house backed to open space which was nice because I didn\'t have to look into some else\'s back yard and vice-versa.

properties.name: Greenfields
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 3355 S Yarrow St, Lakewood, CO 80227Primarily a bar. All bar boxes. Weekly tournaments.

properties.name: Metro 9
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Fairly new place. About 14 tables. Big screen viewable from everywhere in hall. Food, bar. Weekly tournaments exist.

properties.name: Mirage Cafe & Sports Bar
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl  8340 W Coal Mine Ave Ste 1 Columbine Valley, CO 80123

properties.name: Parent's House
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl This is where my parents live today and where I used to live while going to high school and some college.

properties.name: Rack 'Em Cue Club
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 1919 S Havana St, Aurora, CO 80014Lots of tables. Food, bar. Tournaments exist. Fairly odd crowd.

properties.name: Sancho's
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Primarily a bar. Very cool place. Young, hippy-ish crowd. 3 bar boxes, quarters, challenge to play. No tournaments.

properties.name: Shakespeare's
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Haven\'t verified this information, but here\'s what I found: Tuesday 7:30 p.m. Open 9-Ball Tuesday 6:30 p.m. Carom Wednesday In-House League Thursday Ladies Night (starts at 5 p.m.) Saturday Ladies Open 9-Ball

properties.name: Shithole Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 1512 Palmer Dr, Laramie, WYThis was the location of my second apartment while in Laramie, WY. I lived here for all of about two months before I moved down to Denver for a job. My fiance, at the time, lived there unfortunately for about 8 months before moving down to Denver with me. We had a cat, Maggie, while at this apartment, she moved with me to Denver.

properties.name: Table Steaks
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Older place. On the shady side. Lots of money around.

properties.name: Table Steaks East
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Nice place, little older. Weekly tournaments. Food, bar, arcade.

properties.name: Table Steaks South
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 101 W Floyd Ave, Englewood, COBrand new pool hall. Lots of tables and players. It\'s open till 4am. Food, bar, and arcade as well.

properties.name: Tarantula's Billiards
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Seedy pool hall with a fairly young, inner-city crowd. Pool is always free and the tables are somewhat decent. Live DJ mixes music. I know nothing about leagues/tournaments here.

properties.name: Temporary Living
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl There was a hotel here for the Air Force while they had the base there that I lived at for a couple months before my mom and I were able to find a place to live. We eventually moved into a small town west of the base. It was a garden-apartment, half below ground, half above. I got quite used to living in the hotel, although I could tell my mother was going mad after awhile. One night there were riots at the front gate. German civilians were rioting against the base and the military had to bring out water canons. They did eventually use them after all other avenues were exhausted, and shortly after they did the riots quelled.

properties.name: Wedding Chapel
properties.description: Posted by Jerryldenver, coThis is where I held my wedding ceremony. The church was awesome and made for a wonderful setting. We went with a Buddhist slant on the ceremony. The wedding photos were amazing that were taken here.

properties.name: Wedding Reception
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl Denver, coThis is where I held my wedding reception. The Renaissance Denver Hotel was awesome for us. We had a beautiful reception and everything went off without a hitch. I was very pleased, thankfully because I spent quite a penny there. We stayed in the Presidential sweet that night which was awesome with all the amenities they provided for a wedding night.

properties.name: Wynkoop Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by Jerryl 1634 18th Street Denver, CO 80202Upstairs is where the pool hall is. About 16 9ft tables, two bar boxes.
